desc: A vinegar-forward sauce, these are the classic hot sauce of the American South. People sometimes also call these 'Cajon' hot sauces.
Sweeter than most hot sauces, a good sriracha has a lot of funk. This sauce won't run off your food, it's thick enough to stay on top of your eggs.
A wonderful simple Indonesian hot sauce; very chunky, mostly peppers, with a little dash of salt and maybe a little vinegar.
Anything where heat is more important than flavor. These are a very modern style. Broadly, anything over ~500,000 SHU. But that number is arbitrary, so let's not get hung up on it.
The infinite variety of everything else. The craft hot sauce movement has people all over the world playing around with hot peppers and making sauces.
